value.title: Power BI Administrator Tenant Settings and Admin Portal
value.excerpt: In the world of Power BI, there are some configurations in the Desktop tool and some on the Service. One of these critical configurations is the Tenant Settings of the Power BI administrator panel. Tenant settings have a list of highly important configurations across your Power BI tenant. If you miss

value.title: Power BI Calendar Visual
value.excerpt: Power BI doesn’t have a built-in calendar visual. Although there are some custom visuals for building a calendar, however, custom visuals come with some limitations sometimes. In this article and video, I explained how you can use built-in visuals to create a calendar visualization in your report. Get

value.title: Power BI DAX   Previous Month to Date, Quarter to Date, and Year to Date Calculations
value.excerpt: If you want to compare the sales up to a particular day and compare it with the previous period (month, quarter, or year) but up to that particular day in that period, then it is called previous month-to-date, previous quarter-to-date, and previous year-to-date. value.title: Replace BLANK with Zero in Power BI Visuals Such as Card
value.excerpt: If you use a field in a visual and based on a combination of slicer selection, that field doesn't have any value, you might see blank in the visual. If you want to replace that blank to zero, here is a trick for you. a very simple trick that you can use anywhere easily. Read more details in my blog post,

value.title: Showing Ranking in a Visual in Power BI using RANKX DAX function
value.excerpt: If you want to show the ranking in a Power BI visual, one way is to use a visual that supports that, such as a Ribbon chart. Another way, which is a more common way, is to write a calculation for rank, and RANKX is a DAX function that can help you with that. In this article and video, I explain how that

value.title: Using ALLEXCEPT vs ALL VALUES
value.excerpt: ALLEXCEPT is a handy DAX function to retrieve all the columns of a table except for some. When used as a CALCULATE modifier, its behavior is less intuitive and might result in inaccurate measures. In this video, we elaborate on the most common mistake when using ALLEXCEPT in CALCULATE. Article and download:

value.title: Analyze data with Power BI
value.excerpt: This module goes beyond viewing and exploring your content and explains how to interact with it by working with reports and dashboards to uncover and share new business insights.

value.title: Connect and analyze your Dynamics 365 data​
value.excerpt: Connect and analyze your Dynamics 365 Data​

value.title: Explore Azure data services for modern analytics
value.excerpt: Understand analytics solutions in the Azure data ecosystem. Explore the architecture of a scalable analytics solution to meet business needs.

value.title: Manage datasets in Power BI
value.excerpt: With Microsoft Power BI, you can build multiple reports from a single dataset, meaning that if you change the dataset, all reports will be updated with that change. Additionally, you can clean and prep data once rather than repeatedly for each report.

value.title: Introduction to modern analytics using Excel and Power BI
value.excerpt: This module introduces the Microsoft modern analytics core suite of tools, including Office 365/Excel 2016+, Power Query, Data Model, Power BI Desktop, and Power BI service. By using modern analytics technologies, you and your organization can work faster, more efficiently, and smarter by using Excel together with Power BI.

value.title: Work with Delta Lake tables in Microsoft Fabric
value.excerpt: Tables in a Microsoft Fabric lakehouse are based on the Delta Lake technology commonly used in Apache Spark. By using the enhanced capabilities of delta tables, you can create advanced analytics solutions.

value.title: How to Get Round Corners on Visuals in Power BI
value.excerpt: Follow these easy-to-follow instructions to learn how to round the corners of your visuals borders in Power BI.
